description: Triangle of numbers a(n,k) = number of terms in n X n determinant with 2 adjacent diagonals of k and k-1 0's (0<=k<=n).
links: J. D. H. Dickson, Discussion of two double series arising from the number of terms in determinants of certain forms, Proc. London Math. Soc., 10 (1879), 120-122.
J. D. H. Dickson, Discussion of two double series arising from the number of terms in determinants of certain forms, Proc. London Math. Soc., 10 (1879), 120-122. [Annotated scanned copy]
formula: Right diagonal is A000271; other entries given by a(n, k)=a(n, k+1)+2a(n-1, k)+a(n-2, k-1).
mathematica: a[n_, n_] := (-1)^n*HypergeometricPFQ[{1, -n, n+1}, {1/2}, 1/4]; a[n_, k_] := a[n, k] = a[n, k+1] + 2*a[n-1, k] + a[n-2, k-1]; Table[a[n, k], {n, 0, 9}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jun 24 2015 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Sep 29 2000
